WebQSP - WD data set.from sentence:
We compare the results on the WebQSP - WD data set in .
As can be seen , the graph models outperform all other models across precision , recall and F-score , with GGNN showing the best over all result .

STAGG architecture.from sentence: The STAGG architecture delivers the worst results in our experiments , the main reason being supposedly that the model had to rely on manually defined features that are less flexible .

Single Edge model.from sentence: The Single Edge model outperforms the more complex Pooled Edges model by a noticeable margin .

Single Edge baseline.from sentence: The Single Edge baseline prefers simple graphs that consist of a single edge which is a good strategy to achieve higher recall values .

Pooled Edges model.from sentence: The Pooled Edges model maintains a better performance across questions of different complexity , which shows the benefits of encoding all graph edges .

STAGG and Single Edge baselines.from sentence: In , we see that for the STAGG and Single Edge baselines the performance on more complex questions drops compared to the results on simpler questions .

GGNN model.from sentence: We see that the GGNN model offers the best results both on simple and complex questions , as it effectively encodes the structure of semantic graphs .
